body: I like it. I totally believe that we should support JDK 11 even though we lose some old versioned compatibility. Let me try to see it eagerly.

Sorry, I made this PR on top of 0.10.1 version, and it seems like something has been changed in this filed in master branch since then.
Now I have local fix of this issue for master branch. I'll update the PR as soon as I have successful run of tests.

> is `web.xml` needed?

I think so.

I don't think the context is currently being used anywhere.
```
<context-param>
    <param-name>configuration</param-name>
    <param-value>deployment</param-value>
  </context-param>
```

but the session-config should work.
```
  <session-config>
    <cookie-config>
      <http-only>true</http-only>
      <secure>true</secure>
    </cookie-config>
  </session-config>
  ```
Issues in my last comment were resolved in the latest commit.
BTW, there are no tests for the features. Could you please add tests for your feature?

Based on https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.jsoup/jsoup do you see a way to patch in the other vulnerability as well?

https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-36033
@dependabot rebase
@dependabot rebase
BTW, why don't we update the latest version?
@zjffdu @Reamer @huage1994 Could you please review this PR? :-)
This is a review test message
yes, we can upgrade to the latest version as well

> @zhugezifang Hello, sorry for the late reply. I glance at your PR and suggest you make a child interpreter like `jdbc.debug` instead of adding a menu. The debug paragraph is currently only for JDBC, but the menu would be exposed for all kinds of paragraphs. `zeppelin-interpreter` package and `NotebookServer` class affect all of interpreters. If you want to make an interpreter-specific feature, I recommend adding a new sub-interpreter. WDYT?

@jongyoul hi，the  menu of sql debug is controlled, it only can be viewed and used in jdbc interpreter, it cannot be viewed in other interpreter
Hi @Reamer, is this PR blocked because of something else? If not, can we merge it?
@dependabot squash and merge
@dependabot squash and merge

Dependabot tried to merge this PR, but received the following error from GitHub:

```
At least 1 approving review is required by reviewers with write access.
```
@dependabot squash and merge
ping @grizzly-monkey
Can we merge this now?

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/9ac9876b47dcdd3fac30ddce1d5123694fd434b3/zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license/LICENSE#L279

The debug paragraph is currently only for JDBC, but the menu would be exposed for all kinds of paragraphs. `zeppelin-interpreter` package and `NotebookServer` class affect all of interpreters. If you want to make an interpreter-specific feature, I recommend adding a new sub-interpreter. WDYT?

The debug paragraph is currently only for JDBC, but the menu would be exposed for all kinds of paragraphs. `zeppelin-interpreter` package and `NotebookServer` class affect all of interpreters. If you want to make an interpreter-specific feature, I recommend adding a new sub-interpreter. WDYT?

> @jongyoul hi，the menu of sql debug is controlled, it only can be viewed and used in jdbc interpreter, it cannot be viewed in other interpreter

@jongyoul hi,could help me to review it?

The CI  error logs looks like to be related to this PR.
```
Error:  Tests run: 38, Failures: 3, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 229.767 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.NotebookTest
Error:  testSchedule  Time elapsed: 5.534 s  <<< FAILURE!
org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: not <null>

Error:  testScheduleDisabledWithName  Time elapsed: 60.538 s  <<< FAILURE!
org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: <true> but was: <false>
```

@holodazoltan Hello ~ Thank you for the outstanding contribution. I'm not an expert on the front but I heard that bower is outdated and should be changed to others.

BTW, I have one minor question. Should we change yarn to do it? We already are using npm and yarn is similar to npm. I basically, would like to keep the current way if it doesn't have any critical issues. I'm not saying which one is better or not, nor which one is promising but I would like to know if we can solve this problem with npm as is. Could you please give me your opinion on it?
@huage1994 Yep. Thank you. I'm also checking it but didn't fix it yet. Let me fix it soon.
@shefali163 Could you please check CI?
@dependabot rebase

Hi @jongyoul! Thanks, I am not an UI expert either, but I know the basics and I can read manuals. I haved faced bower [certificate has expired](https://github.com/bower/bower/issues/2608) issue at work, then I found [ZEPPELIN-5792](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-5792) ticket, which is still open, so I thought let's give a try. 

yarn (classic) and npm are very similar, both are package managers and read package.json, have their own lock file, ... [package manager comparison](https://www.coana.tech/post/picking-the-best-package-manager-a-2023-comparison-of-npm-yarn-and-pnpm) 
You can execute any existing command in both way: eg. `npm run e2e` or `yarn run e2e`, but I do not recommend to use in a mixed way. In this case I'd choose npm. Personally I prefer yarn, but npm is also great. 

I'll rework this PR to use npm only.
@holodazoltan Thank you for the reply and for making the changes. I look forward to seeing it.
@holodazoltan Thank you for the contribution. Let's see how CI goes.

@jongyoul CI was not ok. In local all zeppelin-web e2e test cases run fine, I think there is some config issue here, CI env has many timeout cases. I pushed a new commit based on protactor issue [suggestions](https://github.com/angular/protractor/issues/4697).

I recently added two PR (https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/4638 , https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/4637) for a more stable CI build. Could you please do a rebase so we can better look at where the CI job breaks.
ping @jongyoul
I don't know who is using hadoop2 but I think we can simplify the number of tests as well. Thank you for the work.

> I don't know who is using hadoop2 but I think we can simplify the number of tests as well. Thank you for the work.

Is on the list. Currently I am trying to remove all Spark versions including 3.2 from our stack.
@dependabot rebase

@holodazoltan Hello, is there any update or problem? I believe that your PR is really helpful for the community but it should pass CI anyway. Can you rebase it to the current master as @Reamer suggested? I can help you if you have any critical issue.
btw, I recommend rebasing this PR from the current master as we solved some CI issues recently.
Why did you close this PR?
Wow, 121 files!! I'll do my best to review it :-)
It appears that @holodazoltan has ceased reporting. If there are no objection, I would like to resubmit the PR with my bug fix.

> It appears that @holodazoltan has ceased reporting. If there are no objection, I would like to resubmit the PR with my bug fix.

Gladly, but please include holodazoltan as a co-author.

Sorry for late reply, my change has some CSS bundling issue, I was working on that, but I don't have any solid result yet. CSS issue can be easily reproduced in local, but I was testing e2e with docker image (old site, not updated one) :(

[matthias-koch](https://github.com/matthias-koch) [Reamer](https://github.com/Reamer) Feel free to resuse and submit any part, I am glad if we can resolve this issue.

Hi @jongyoul 
I have outsourced some code in additional PRs to simplify the review.
@Reamer Thank you! It's easier to review it. I approve of them. Please merge whenever you want. Then, Let me prepare for the next release.
Superseded by #4650.
@Reamer I think it should be fine. Could you please check it again and merge it if you think it's ok too?
The removing seems is incomplete, some modules like livy and rlang still depend on Spark 2.4.x

Yes, some other interpreters could still support the versions of Spark. This PR, however, aims to remove the support by Spark interpreter only. The title is a bit unclear but I thought the purpose is quite clear.
@dependabot rebase
@dkaznacheev @ileasile the Koltin version is pretty old and depends on unstable API, do you guys have a plan to upgrade it to keep things up-to-date?
Thx for the follow-up.

The failed Kotlin test seems to be https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-38325

I suppose we must upgrade Kotlin first to address it. Unfortunately, the Kotlin interpreter uses a very old version (1.3.x, the latest is 1.9.x), and couple with lots of unstable APIs.

https://endoflife.date/kotlin

@ileasile I hit https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-38325 when trying to upgrade Spark to recent versions (3.2+) in https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/4652, I think it is blocked by the Kotlin upgrading.
@zjffdu @Reamer @jongyoul how many users using Kotlin Interpreter? It seems does not get actively maintained and blocks the core feature(upgrade Spark Interpreter to modern version) of Zeppelin.

> @zjffdu @Reamer @jongyoul how many users using Kotlin Interpreter? It seems does not get actively maintained and blocks the core feature(upgrade Spark Interpreter to modern version) of Zeppelin.

I do not know a user amount. Personally, I do not use the Kotlin interpreter. There are several efforts to update it. 
The latest PR this year.
https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/4567

According to the following document there were no plans to remove it. https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ZEPPELIN/Interpreter+Maintenance

> There are several efforts to update it.

I don't think the simple unsuccessful version bumping should be counted. Obviously, the Kotlin upgrade involves lots of internal Kotlin implementation, which requires the Kotlin experts to participate.

>According to the following document there were no plans to remove it. https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ZEPPELIN/Interpreter+Maintenance

IMHO, Kotlin interpreter was supported by Jetbrains but there's no progress so we can remove it first and add it later if it's needed.
@zhaomoran Hello, thank you for your contribution. I left a comment and could you please add test cases? I read your ticket and looks fine but I think it would be better to have a test for this case.
@jongyoul OK，I just presented the idea here. If the community thinks it's a good idea, I'll add test cases to it.
I believe that your contribution must help others. :-)
I have completed the JUnit5 migration today. Can you please rebase your branch to the current master branch.
Please perform a rebase. I have recently migrated the tests to JUnit5. Currently there are merge conflicts.
@jongyoul I think this PR is ready to go. I searched and removed all content contains "kotlin" from the whole codebase. CI passed except to one frontend flaky test.
@jongyoul This is my first time submitting a PR. Is there anything else I need to do?

@zhaomoran The last step is making all CI green. We have some flaky tests but I usually try to execute some failed tests again to make it green. Your contribution itself is proper to be merged. Could you please wait for a while until the CI becomes green?
@zhaomoran Thank you for your first contribution. I hope you contribute more and more. I merged your PR and assigned you with the JIRA ticket as well.

@pan3793 
Is this PR ready for review?

@Reamer not yet, I need to revert some changes.

Sorry, I'm quite busy these days, will find the time to finish it ASAP.
LGTM as well. BTW, it will help to reduce our compile time :-)
Closed because follow-up pull request #4651 was merged.

The profiles `scala-2.11` and `scala-2.12` defined at root `pom.xml` seems only affects the livy module's test, if so, do we really need to maintain such profiles? Why not hardcode in `livy/pom.xml`(seems livy is not much active, the latest version only support Scala 2.11)
cc @Reamer

> The profiles `scala-2.11` and `scala-2.12` defined at root `pom.xml` seems only affects the livy module's test, if so, do we really need to maintain such profiles? Why not hardcode in `livy/pom.xml`(seems livy is not much active, the latest version only support Scala 2.11)

The profiles `scala-2.11` and `scala-2.12` set the properties `scala.version` and `scala.binary.version`.

I see accesses to these properties in the Zeppelin Display Module and Zeppelin Distribution Module. Unfortunately, I don't currently know why Scala dependencies are needed in the Zeppelin Distribution Module.

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/85bb3b4ca2d4a5c79194f8c12a90b732d777ccc5/zeppelin-display/pom.xml#L34-L55

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/85bb3b4ca2d4a5c79194f8c12a90b732d777ccc5/zeppelin-distribution/pom.xml#L49-L73
Oh, I missed the Zeppelin Display Module(it does not appear when I do global search using IDEA), it leverages the scala-xml to build `AngularElem`, that's why scala is required
Emm, is "Zeppelin Display Module" only used by "Zeppelin: Spark Interpreter"? If so, I suppose the Zeppelin core becomes scala free if we can merge this module into "Zeppelin: Spark Interpreter"

As far as I know, the Zeppelin display module is only used by the Spark interpreter.

If it is possible we can merge the Display Module to the Spark Interpreter Module.

> As far as I know, the Zeppelin display module is only used by the Spark interpreter.
> 
> If it is possible we can merge the Display Module to the Spark Interpreter Module.

Thanks for information, would like a try in another PR.

I limit this PR's scope to the spark related stuffs, CI already passed, and [the last commit](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/4652/commits/c6bcc863771eb53356fb800821bb9ef5ebd5ca26) only touch the docs
I will merge this pull request on Friday as long as no other comment is received.
@zjffdu do you have time to complete this PR? BTW, Flink 1.18 is on the way ~

BTW, Spark 3.5 drops support for Python 3.7
https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/getting_started/install.html#python-versions-supported

I'm not very familiar with Python, according to https://endoflife.date/python, Python 3.7 is EOL, and would appreciate it if the maintainers could add support for new versions of Python and upgrade the default Python version to 3.9 or above (since 3.9 is the first version which supports Apple Silicon, 3.9 also is used for Apache Spark CI). Also, I can try my best to do such upgrading if no one wants to take it.
cc @jongyoul @Reamer
Bot?
will rebase once https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/4668 get in

Obviously, upgrading Elasticsearch from 2.x to 7.10.x(it's the latest version released under Apache License V2, or later) is not a simple version bumping, I suppose this module lacks of maintenance too, and should be considered for removal.
cc @Reamer
cc @Reamer
I have never used the Debian package. I do not know if this change will cause problems. Maybe it is also better if we remove deb support. ping @Leemoonsoo
This is what I made and it was used in Apache Bigtop before. I checked it now simply and it's not used anymore. I think it could be removed.

@pan3793 Yes, I think so. BTW, to do that, it would be better to make a ticket to handle it.
@jongyoul sure, I'm going to create a JIRA
